author: 程子奕,林志偉
title: 獎金未納薪資遭控欠加班費　佳格：符合規範明將與工會協商│TVBS新聞網
text:
佳格企業工會今（19）日上午，發起在佳格桃園大園廠門口抗議記者會，因公司幾十年來都固定在每年農曆春節以及6月各發放一筆固定為1個月工資的春節、年中獎金，此為固定薪資，公司卻未在加班費、勞保、勞退等項目計算時，把這兩筆獎金納入計算。以發起訴訟的66位基層員工來計算，要爭取的加班費用已經破600萬。而佳格公司今天上午也發聲明，對於員工薪酬、獎金、勞健保等計算，皆符合法令規範；集團與工會已進行過多次會議，雙方也預定於6/20進行下次協商會議；對於工會提出的各項訴求，公司將抱持正面態度，傾聽員工心聲。
 佳格企業工會副理事長王逸翔表達這次最主要訴求，就是春節、年中獎金共2個月的固定薪資，希望納入健保、勞退還有加班費的計算。「以公司說法那是獎金，但之前的訴訟已經確定是工資。」王逸翔認為，這件案子已經跟公司持續談將近兩年，公司一直表達曖昧，他覺得是在拖延時間，導致到現在我們要發起訴訟。
王逸翔透露，以目前大園廠發起訴訟的66位基層員工來計算，要爭取的費用已經破600萬了。而整個大園廠500多人，其中約200多個基層員工都有欠加班費。
一名任職38年的資深員工表示，6月、12月獎金法律上屬固定薪資，但稱公司說獎金為「恩惠性給予」，因此目前並未納入計算加班計算。但過去退休人員與公司有訴訟，法院判決這兩筆獎金屬於工資；他以此為據，合理合法來爭取這筆加班費也要算給我們在職員工。
 對於工會的訴求，佳格食品集團發聲明表示，佳格秉持以人為本的核心，關切員工福利與待遇的持續提升。對於員工薪酬、獎金、勞健保等計算，皆符合法令規範。針對工會本次所提議題，集團已與工會進行多次會議討論，雙方也預定於6/20進行下次協商會議。關於佳格食品企業工會提出的各項訴求，集團將抱持正面態度，傾聽員工心聲，並持續與工會進行協商。公司期許與工會能在彼此互信互利的基準下，儘速達成共識，達到公司、員工和利害關係人等多方皆贏的解決之道。

VIDEO : अलीगढ़ में सात महीने से वेतन न मिलने पर नलकूप कर्मियों ने पानी की टंकी पर चढ़कर किया हंगामा
अलीगढ़ ब्यूरो
Updated Fri, 29 Nov 2024 12:59 PM IST
Link Copied
सात महीने से वेतन न मिलने से गुस्साए नौ नलकूप कर्मचारी 28 नवंबर को महेंद्रनगर कालीदह स्थित पानी की टंकी पर चढ़ गए। इसके बाद दो घंटे तक जबरदस्त हंगामा होता रहा। पुलिस और जल निगम के अफसरों के समझाने पर कर्मचारी टंकी से उतरे। नगर आयुक्त ने इन कर्मियों को 29 नवंब आज आफिस में बुलाया है, ताकि उनका वेतन भुगतान हो सके।

author: Redazione
title: Alla Civica 15A la mostra di Francesco Fantoni "Acqua alle nuvole"
text:
Ricchi da Superbonus: Edoardo Barzago, 23 anni, possiede 2,4 miliardi di crediti
[Fabrizio Gatti](http://www.today.it/opinioni/edoardo-barzago-studente-piu-ricco-italia-crediti-superbonus.html)
Domenica 15 dicembre alle 11 al Circolo Arci Civica 15a inaugura la nuova mostra di Francesco Fantoni "Acqua alle nuvole", che resterà aperta fino al 18 gennaio. Difficile dire se c’è più tecnica o poesia nelle opere di Francesco Fantoni, architetto, fotografo, artista ma soprattutto inventore. Mescolando chimica e meccanica, antiche tecniche e moderne tecnologie, Fantoni in "Acqua alle nuvole" utilizza la sua amata macchina fotografica per sperimentare inedite combinazioni di acidi e sali, inventare nuovi procedimenti di stampa e costruire mondi fantastici che ci offre con generosità appassionata.
Quello che fa Fantoni è rendere evidente la semplicità della complessità: impossibile rimanere indifferenti davanti alla magia dei suoi lavori, evanescenti creazioni poetiche a conferma che “l’essenziale è invisibile agli occhi”.
Il procedimento e il trattamento delle immagini richiama suggestioni di oriente, delle culture tra buddismo e scintoismo che definiamo genericamente “zen” per la rarefazione e l’essenzialità che ritroviamo anche nelle tre idee del buddismo sul colore
che descrivono il suo carattere effimero, la vacuità di qualsiasi tinta, indefinibile, variabile e, alla fine, inesistente e la sua interdipendenza poiché il colore non esiste in quanto tale, ma è legato all’umidità, alla presenza e all’assenza del sole, dell’ombra e delle nuvole appunto.
Tutto ciò è ben presente nella mostra che ci invita, con un gesto, a riconoscere l’estrema difficoltà e fragilità che si cela in ognuna di queste incredibili creazioni dietro le quali c’è ironia e struggimento, tanto lavoro e curiosità, tanta ricerca e condivisione.
Quell’atto di mettere nelle nostre mani il pennello, perché bagnandolo e passandolo sul foglio diventiamo noi stessi gli autori, è di un artista che ci affida la creazione dell’opera, ritirandosi con un gesto di amore verso l’umanità a cui offre la possibilità di creazioni poetiche e profonde che urlano in silenzio il bisogno di esistere e di essere svelate.
E’ forse anche un gesto intimo e disarmato che affida a tutti e tutte noi la protezione della natura nel suo aspetto più delicato e impermanente, le nuvole, ciò nonostante essenziale nel preservare la vita sulla terra, che siamo invitati a curare e soccorrere dando acqua, dando amore.

author: @TUDNUSA
title: Caso entre Alicia Villarreal y Cruz 'N' podría dar un giro inesperado; ahora él planearía demandarla por difamación
text:
Caso entre Alicia Villarreal y Cruz ‘N’ podría dar un giro inesperado; ahora él planearía demandarla por difamación
Tras acusaciones por violencia, el productor buscaría contraatacar legalmente y ya alista una demanda, según medios. Esto es lo que se sabe.
La disputa legal entre Alicia Villarreal y su aún esposo Cruz ‘N’ sigue escalando. Después de que la cantante lo denunció por presunta violencia familiar, el caso ha dado un giro inesperado. El productor ahora planea demandarla por difamación, de acuerdo con información reciente.
Se revierte el caso, ahora Cruz ‘N’ podría contra demandar a Alicia Villarreal
En un nuevo giro del caso, el medio de comunicación POSTA reveló que Cruz ‘N’ está preparando una demanda por difamación contra Alicia Villarreal y otras siete personas, incluyendo a comunicadores y productores.
El todavía esposo de la cantante está planeando una demanda con sus abogados mexicanos, asesorados por la polémica abogada Camille Vázquez por el tema de difamación. Dicha demanda involucra a 8 personas, y aunque no se mencionan nombres, se comienzan a especular los posibles demandados, y claro figura el nombre de la cantante regia, así como productores y comunicadores
Cita el mencionado medio. Hasta ahora, Cruz ‘N’ no ha confirmado esta información públicamente, pero se espera que en las próximas semanas ofrezca una conferencia de prensa para explicar su postura y confirmar el inicio de este nuevo proceso legal.
Alicia Villarreal y Cruz ‘N’, del escándalo a los tribunales: ¿por qué comenzó todo?
Fue en febrero cuando Alicia Villarreal acudió a un hospital en Monterrey tras, supuestamente, haber sido agredida por Cruz ‘N’. Poco después, durante un concierto, la cantante realizó una señal de auxilio que dejó paralizados a todos sus seguidores y dejó ver lo ocurrido.
Esto la llevó a presentar una denuncia formal por violencia familiar, lo cual también derivó en una orden de restricción. “Ha sido algo impactante también para mí, para la gente, siento que es algo que no debo de vivir ni debe de pasar ninguna mujer ni ninguna persona”, expresó la intérprete de ‘Te Aprovechas’ en ese entonces.
Desde el principio, Cruz ‘N’ ha negado las acusaciones, afirmando confiar en la justicia para limpiar su nombre.
Sin embargo, el caso volvió a tomar relevancia a principios de julio, cuando Cruz ‘N’ no acudió a una audiencia programada el día 3, lo que llevó a las autoridades a emitir una orden de aprehensión. Al no haber una justificación inmediata, se creyó que el productor estaba huyendo.
No fue sino días después que su equipo legal aclaró la situación, la orden había sido suspendida gracias a un amparo, y la ausencia del productor se debió a problemas médicos. Aunque no se revelaron detalles sobre su estado de salud, Cruz pidió comprensión y respeto ante su situación.
La batalla judicial entre ambos artistas apenas comienza, y todo apunta a que será un proceso largo y mediático.
Para más detalles sobre este caso y otras noticias del espectáculo, entra al sitio oficial de Las Estrellas.

author: VNExplorer
title: ‘Incorrect translation’: Assam CM Himanta Sarma apologises after his post on Vaishyas, Shudras triggers row
text:
‘Incorrect translation’: Assam CM Himanta Sarma apologises after his post on Vaishyas, Shudras triggers row
Two days after his social media post on “Swabhabik Karma” or “natural duties” of Vaishyas and Shudras triggered a row, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday apologised for the post and deleted it saying that one of his team members had posted a verse from the Bhagavad Gita with an “incorrect translation”.
Sarma also sought to emphasise that Assam has a “casteless society” due to the social reforms spearheaded by Shrimant Sankardeva, who is considered a major spiritual leader in the state.
Taking to X, formerly Twitter, chief minister Sarma wrote, “As a routine I upload one sloka of Bhagavad Gita every morning on my social media handles. Till date, I have posted 668 slokas. Recently one of my team members posted a sloka from Chapter 18 verse 44 with an incorrect translation. As soon as I noticed the mistake, I promptly deleted the post. The state of Assam reflects a perfect picture of a casteless society, thanks to the reform movement led by Mahapurush Srimanta Sankardeva…”.
“…If the deleted post has offended anyone, I sincerely apologize,” he added.
On December 26, the BJP leader had posted a verse on his X handle which can be translated as follows, “Bhagwan Shri Krishna himself describes the natural duties of Vaishya and Shudras”. Sarma had also posted a video citing the 44th verse from ‘Sanyas Jog’ in the 18th chapter of the Gita. The video explains that agriculture, cow rearing and business are the “natural duties” of Vaishyas, while serving Brahmins, Kshatriyas and Vaishyas is the “natural duty” of Shudras.
Sharply criticising the post, the CPI(M) shared a screenshot of it and wrote, “We strongly denounce Assam CM Himanta Biswas tweet claiming that “Shudras are to serve Brahmins, Kshatriyas and Vaishyas”.
In its post on X, the Communist party also slammed the chief minister’s statement, calling it “BJPs Manuvadi ideology in full play”.
Meanwhile, Sarma put up another verse from the Gita on Friday in continuation of his daily posts from the Hindu scripture.
For the latest news from across India, Political updates, Explainers, Sports News, Opinion, Entertainment Updates and more Top News, visit Indian Express. Subscribe to our award-winning Newsletter Download our App here Android & iOS

author: Rob King
title: Washington Fish and Wildlife bans campfires, target shooting due to wildfire risk | News | kxly.com
text: SPOKANE, WA -- The Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife is restricting what people can do on state lands in Eastern Washington to help reduce wildfire risk. WDFW says starting July 1, the following changes go into effect on state lands: SPOKANE, WA -- The Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife is restricting what people can do on state lands in Eastern Washington to help reduce wildfire risk. WDFW says starting July 1, the following changes go into effect on state lands: - All campfires including those in fire rings are prohibited. Personal gas camp stoves will still be allowed. - Shooting firearms when not lawfully hunting. Target shooting can only be done at two department shooting ranges, Methow Shooting Range and Asotin Creek Shooting Range until August 15. - From August 16-September 15, all target shooting including at the ranges is prohibited. - Smoking is prohibited expect in an enclosed vehicle. - Welding and operating chainsaws is prohibited. - Operating a motor vehicle away from developed roads is prohibited. For more information, check the [Washington Wildfire Information Page](https://wdfw.wa.gov/about/wdfw-lands/wildfire). “We all have a part to play in preventing wildfires, and we’re urging visitors enjoying Washington’s great outdoors this summer to be a part of the solution,” said Cynthia Wilkerson, WDFW’s Lands Division Manager. “By recreating responsibly and following wildfire safety restrictions, visitors can help protect public recreation lands, wildlife habitat, and health and safety for local communities.” COPYRIGHT 2024 BY KXLY. author: Cindy O. Herman For The Daily Item
title: Danville Drama Club takes on history, mystery with 'Anastasia'
text:
DANVILLE — We all love a good rags to riches story, especially when a poor street sweeper learns she’s really descended from a very royal and wealthy family.
Danville Area High School will present “Anastasia” Thursday, Friday and Saturday at 7 p.m. at the high school on Ironmen Lane.
“‘Anastasia’ is about a young girl named Anya who has lost her family and knows nothing about her true identity,” said Aubyn Johnson, director of the musical. “She works as a street sweeper just to earn enough money to travel from Russia to Paris to meet with her grandmother, who is the one remaining family member that she remembers. Anya is determined that nothing will stop her on this journey and that she will be able to prove that she is the Grand Duchess Anastasia Romanov. I believe this story of identity and determination is a beautiful story and one that everyone should see.”
The student performers have been working hard to dig into their characters’ personalities.
“Anya is based on the real life Anastasia Romanov,” said Kyla Brookhart, a junior. “Anya is determined to discover who she really is after she gets amnesia. I love playing Anya because I think everyone, including myself, can learn something from her unwavering hope and strength.”
“My character is a grandmother who has gone through a lot of loss in life,” said Jera Strony, a senior. “She is very stubborn but also very confident in herself. I love that she sticks to her heart no matter what and never lets anyone put her down.”
Senior Collin Cummins plays the role of Dmitry, a con artist from the streets of St. Petersburg.
“He is shaped by his environment, being forced to come up with innovative ideas and strategies to make his way through the world he lives in,” Cummins said. “I enjoy playing Dmitry because his confidence really shines through, and it gives me a chance as an actor to make new decisions I may not normally make.”
Owen Crane, also a senior, can use his role to add some humor to the show.
“I play Vlad who acts as the comic relief and a father figure to both Anya and Dmitry,” Crane said. “One thing I like about playing this part is the interactions I have with the rest of the cast. I feel like there are lots of opportunities to have fun with the scenes and act almost like a human cartoon.”
Rehearsals have brought laughs and collaboration to the students.
Brookhart recalled that when the cast list came out, Elyse Spahr’s mother took the phone from Elyse to talk to Brookhart. Strony savors the memory of “running around with Elyse and singing backstage with the stage crew.”
Cummins enjoyed the learning process.
“I had so much fun learning with such a collaborative and supportive group of people, and the collective excitement and support when someone hit a great note or the group sang a great chord made the process all that more enjoyable,” he said.
Students found ways to have fun even with the mundane task of checking their mics.
“Every day before our dress rehearsals we do mic checks to make sure our sound system is working well, and we always have a different theme,” Crane said. “Sometimes it will be singing our favorite song, doing impressions, or just sharing what we ate that day. All together I think it brings the cast together and makes us more like a family than a drama club.”
One of Johnson’s most exciting moments happened after a dress rehearsal. He had given John Marks (playing the character Gleb, villain of the story) homework to listen to a song from the musical “Ragtime” as inspiration for his character.
“Not only did John do his homework but the next time we rehearsed, he had so much conviction, power and authority on the stage that I was staggered and couldn’t help but give him his flowers at the end of the rehearsal,” Johnson said. “His has a role that he has been nervous about and this is his first time on stage as a part of the Drama Club, and for John to make that much progress after just one night, I can only imagine where his character will take him by the time the show opens.”
Cindy O. Herman lives in Snyder County. Email comments to her at

author: Equality Health Foundation
title: Equality Health Foundation Expands Reach to Virginia and Louisiana
text: Nonprofit Programs Extend Equality Health's Impact into Local Communities SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., April 18, 2024 /PRNewswire-PRWeb/ -- Equality Health Foundation , the philanthropic partner of Equality Health LLC and an organization dedicated to advancing health equity and improving well-being access for underserved communities, proudly announces its expansion into Virginia and Louisiana. The nonprofit is currently serving residents and communities in Arizona, Texas, Tennessee, in addition to the new markets. This announcement reinforces Equality Health LLC's commitment to expand availability of its value-based care programs in these states and represents a significant step forward in the Foundation's mission to address health disparities and promote inclusive healthcare practices across historically marginalized populations. With the expansion, Equality Health Foundation will bring community-based health and well-being programs to Virginia and Louisiana, including health festivals, college scholarship collaboratives, well-child and maternal health programs, and well-being initiatives. The Equality Health Foundation collaborates with local nonprofits, health plans, providers, and other community partners, serving as a powerful vehicle for community impact and fostering healthier communities where individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, socio-economic status or geographic location have access to well-being resources and comprehensive, whole-person care. Equality Health LLC has committed to supporting expanding the work of its Foundation in each new market it serves. "Expanding into Virginia and Louisiana is an important milestone as we continue our efforts to advance health equity and well-being in underserved communities," said Tomás León, president of Equality Health Foundation. "We look forward to working alongside local organizations and community leaders to implement innovative solutions that improve healthcare access and outcomes for all." A new report conducted by Virginia Commonwealth University reveals deep and consistent health disparities in the state, and that a person's race, ethnicity and address are major predictors of dying prematurely. Data revealed that two-thirds of all premature deaths in Northern Virginia between 2015-2019 were avoidable, including deaths from certain cancers, heart disease, injuries, alcohol and drugs and diabetes. With lifestyle changes, screenings, immunizations, or better medical treatments, many deaths of this nature could be averted. The Foundation is equally invested in addressing significant health disparities in Louisiana, which ranks 49th in children's overall health and well-being. The Black community (which comprises 34% of the state's population), reports a higher risk for heart disease, stroke, cancer, asthma, influenza and pneumonia than their white counterparts. "We recognize the importance of addressing the root causes of health disparities and increasing equitable access to healthcare and well-being resources," stated León. "Together with our partner organization, Equality Health LLC, we are committed to building an inclusive health ecosystem." For more information on Equality Health Foundation, please visit equalityhealthfoundation.org . About Equality Health Foundation Established in 2019, Equality Health Foundation envisions a world of vibrant and inclusive communities where all individuals have the opportunity to live healthier and longer lives. A bold vision like this cannot be accomplished alone and requires extensive collaboration across local communities around the country to level the playing field and make a sustainable and transformative change—a movement for advancing equal access to health and well-being for all. About Equality Health LLC Equality Health is a technology-enabled primary care platform that leverages the proven capabilities of value-based payment models to transform healthcare for diverse and often marginalized populations. From predictive modeling to advanced care-tracking tools, utilizing Equality Health's proprietary software, participating PCPs can streamline value-based administration and stay one step ahead of a patient's journey. Equality Health's care model is Medicaid-first in design, partnering with over 3,200 PCPs and 700,000 lives across AZ, TX, TN, LA and VA. Equality Health partners with practices to close care gaps, optimize performance, increase compliance, and improve profitability. Members engage with holistic and personalized programs delivered through the lens of social and cultural needs. Equality Health is revolutionizing how care is delivered by establishing critical linkages with payers, providers, members, and community resources. Media Contact Jennifer Howard, Evolve PR & Marketing, 1 480-438-1602, [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#e58f8d8a92849781a580938a8993809597848b818884978e80918c8b82cb868a88), https://evolveprandmarketing.com/ SOURCE Equality Health Foundation
